p:
In Table 1 , we summarize the differences between MR and CM describing causes, goals, processes, as well as distinct and shared outcomes.Table 1
Differences and Similarities between Climate Migration and Managed Retreat.
Climate MigrationManaged RetreatSources
CausesLast resort due to lack of alternativesLast resort/one of several adaptation optionsMcLeman et al., 2016, Hino et al., 2017
Climate change is an indirect cause – multiple factors trigger mobilityClimate change is a direct cause – usually a specific hazard prompts relocation (e.g. flood, drought, SLR)Afifi, 2011, Gray and Mueller, 2012
Often reactionaryAnticipatory or reactionaryBlack et al., 2013, Huang, 2018, Ajibade, 2019
Focused largely on peopleFocus on people, assets, and ecosystemsAlexander et al., 2012, Hanna et al., 2019
Focused on reducing vulnerabilityFocused on increasing resilienceAfifi and Jäger, 2010, Ahmed and McEvoy, 2014
GoalsSeeking new livelihoods and safetySeeking safe location as a primary goalBlack et al., 2011, Ajibade, 2019
Migrants move towards economic centersRelocatees may move away from economic centersHammond, 2008, Afifi, 2011, Ajibade, 2019
Not focused on land makingLand making and remaking are consideredHanna et al., 2019, Ajibade, 2019
ProcessSelf-fundedMay be state or community fundedDun, 2011, Carrasco et al., 2016, Mortreux et al., 2018, Siders, 2019
No clear planOften involves a planning processFarbotko and Lazrus, 2012, Maly and Ishikawa, 2013, Arnall, 2019
No clear destinationDestination may be knownBlack and Collyer, 2014, Hermann and Kempf, 2017
No buyoutsPotential for buyoutsMaly and Ishikawa, 2013, Siders, 2019, Mach et al., 2019;
Gaps in legal protectionMay include legal or other protectionsMcAdam and Ferris, 2015, Atapattu, 2020.
OutcomesDifferentDoes not protect property rightsMay protect private property rightsGebauer and Doevenspeck, 2015, Siders, 2019.
No compensationMay include compensationMach et al., 2019, Maly and Ishikawa, 2013
Labels: climate refugees, migrants, displacedNo clear label/displaced personsGold et al., 2019, Hanna et al., 2019
Loss of human capitalRedistribution of human capitalKothari, 2014, Dreher and Voyer, 2015
SharedLoss of identity, culture, and placeLoss of identity, culture, and placeMortreux and Barnett, 2009, Huang, 2018
Resettlement site may be hazardousResettlement site may be hazardousHuang, 2018, Rana and Nessa, 2017
Can reveal inequality in power and classCan reveal inequality in power and classMcLeman et al., 2016, Ajibade, 2019
Can allow for successful adaptationCan allow for successful adaptationKartiki, 2011, Albert et al., 2016
